para.verbatim:
Export selected tensors from a PyTorch checkpoint to row-major float32 .bin files.
Usage examples:
# List all tensor names in a checkpoint python3 scripts/export_tensors_torch.py --checkpoint model.ckpt --list
# Export specific tensors by state_dict key python3 scripts/export_tensors_torch.py \ --checkpoint model.ckpt \ --tensor "rnn.weight_hh_l0:bin/Wxh.bin" \ --tensor "classifier.weight:bin/Woh.bin" \ --transpose Woh # if classifier.weight is [V, H] and you need [H, V], don't use --transpose # if it's [H, V] and you need [V, H], add its alias in --transpose
Notes: - Tensors are written in **row-major float32**; we do not change layout unless you request a transpose via --transpose <alias>. - Use --alias to give a short name to each export so you can target it in --transpose. - You can repeat --tensor and --alias multiple times; order matters: alias i corresponds to tensor i.
